main event: A sighting report from April 1957 describes an object shaped like a parachute and several silver objects hovering near it in Colorado Springs.
interesting points: The object was described as white and half the size of a C-46 aircraft., Several silver objects were observed moving due east., The sighting lasted for about 30 seconds., There was a possibility that the objects could have been balloons according to local air force reports., The conclusion of the report suggested that the sighting was probably caused by a balloon.
sighted object: one parachute-shaped object and several silver objects
witness description: Conrad force East Center G-47 did not see the object.
